creator: rtariq919394
title: Beats By Rokhaya Tariq and Khalin Chand (DIY Headphones)
materials_required: 2 neodymium magnets (1.5 cm in diameter each)
description: This is a step-by-step guide to make affordable headphones. The project demonstrates how headphones work using magnets, voice coils, and a diaphragm (cups) to produce sound through vibrations. It involves creating a magnetic field, using a voice coil to generate vibrations, and amplifying those vibrations with a cup to create audible sound.
steps: Wrap a post-it around a glue stick with the adhesive facing outward to create a round shape for the coil.
Wrap the wire around the post-it covered glue stick to create a tight 30-coil wire. Tape the sides to secure the coil.
Repeat the coil-making process to create a second coil.
Place at least one magnet inside each cup and another on the outside of the bottom of each cup.
Secure the voice coil to the inside of the cup using electrical tape.
Sand the ends of the coil wires to remove the coating.
Attach additional wire to the sanded ends of the coil wires and melt the wires together for a secure connection. Repeat for the other cup.
Attach the other end of the wires to the phone plug.
Plug the aux cord into an audio source (phone, laptop, etc.) and play a song.
If sound is weak, sand the wire ends more thoroughly and ensure the coils are tightly wound.

creator: rtariq919394
title: Beats By Rokhaya Tariq and Khalin Chand (DIY Headphones)
materials_required: 2 neodymium magnets (1.5 cm in diameter each)
description: This is a step-by-step guide to make affordable headphones. The project utilizes magnets, a voice coil, and a diaphragm to produce sound. The loudness and quality of the sound are affected by the density of the medium the sound travels through and the strength of the magnetic field.
steps: Buy Plastic Cups and a Glue Stick If You Do Not Have Any in Your Home From the 99 Cent Store.
Grab Your Glue Stick and Wrap a Post-it Around the Glue Stick. Make Sure the Adhesive Is Afcing Outward When Applying the Post It.

Grab your wire, and make the 30-coil wire using your post-it covered glue stick so you are able to take the coil off of the glue stick. Make sure the coils are tight and does not resemble a slinky (loose, curly wire). Tape two sides of the coil so the coil stays tight. Do the same for your second coil.
Repeat Step 3 for Second Coil
Place at least one magnet in the bottom of each cup and the other magnet on the outside of the bottom of each cup.
Secure Voice Coil to the Cup With Electrical Tape.

There should be two pieces of wire sticking out from the coil. Take one end of the coil and sand the ends of the coil. Take 6-10 inches of extra wire from the wire you have and attach it to the coil’s end. Melt the wire to make the two wires stay together. Do the same for your other cup. Attach the other end of the attached wire to the aux cord you bought.
Plug in Aux Cord to Audio Source (phone, Laptop, Etc.), and Play a Song.
If There Is Trouble With Your Sound, Sand the Ends of Your Wire More and Make Sure the Coils Are Tight.

creator: rtariq919394
title: Beats By Rokhaya Tariq and Khalin Chand (DIY Headphones)
materials_required: 2 neodymium magnets (1.5 cm in diameter each)
description: This is a step-by-step guide to make affordable headphones. It uses magnets, voice coils, and a diaphragm (cup) to produce sound through vibrations. The quality and loudness of the sound are affected by the magnetic field strength and the density of the medium the vibrations travel through.
steps: Gather the required materials: Styrofoam or plastic cups, a phone plug (3.5 mm), electrical tape, 28 awg wire (about 50 inches), P-220 sandpaper (about 3 inches), 2 neodymium magnets (1.5 cm in diameter each), a glue stick, post-its and a lighter.
If you don't have any plastic cups or a glue stick, purchase them.
Wrap a post-it around a glue stick with the adhesive facing outward to create a form for the coil.
Wrap the wire around the post-it covered glue stick to create a 30-coil wire. Ensure the coils are tight. Tape the sides of the coil to maintain its shape. Repeat this step to create a second coil.
Repeat step 3 for the second coil.
Place at least one magnet in the bottom of each cup and the other magnet on the outside of the bottom of each cup.
Secure the voice coil to the inside of the cup using electrical tape.

Sand the ends of the wires sticking out from the coil. Attach 6-10 inches of extra wire to the coil's end and melt the wires to make the connection. Repeat for the other cup. Attach the other end of the wire to the phone plug.
Plug the phone plug into an audio source and play a song.
If there is trouble with your sound, sand the ends of the wire more and make sure the coils are tight.
